entities.description: A measurable variable used to represent certain metrics in the dataset. Here represented with values '1', '6', and '12'.
The raw count of survey responses corresponding to each indicator value.
The percentage representation of each indicator’s frequency in comparison to the total survey responses.
The number of months within a given period where the behavior or condition was reported.
The number of responses missing data in the survey.
Metrics such as mean, median, mode, minimum, maximum, and standard deviation describing the distribution of the data.

relationships.description: Relates the survey to the statistical metrics computed for the responses.
Indicates the measurable variables used to represent certain metrics in the dataset surveyed.
Indicates the raw count of survey responses for each indicator value.
Relates the indicator to its percentage representation in relation to total survey responses.
Relates the survey to the number of reported months for behaviors or conditions.
Relates the survey responses to the number of missing values in the dataset.
